content:
Add a Menu to a FlexCard

Create a menu from a list of actions on a FlexCard. Style the menu button, and each action in the menu's dropdown. Add any action type available in the FlexCard Designer.

From the FlexCard Designer, drag a Menu element into a state on the canvas.
(Optional) Update the element name in the Element Name field.
(Optional) Enter the visible label of the menu button in the Label field.
Beginning Summer '21, Label supports concatenated strings.

(Optional) Change the default menu button icon by entering its name or searching for it.
(Optional) Disable scrolling in the dropdown when there are more than 5 menu items.
(Optional) Change the position and size of the dropdown menu.

To add actions, click + Add New Action. See Add a Click Event to a FlexCard Element to configure action properties.

Beginning Winter '22, add conditions that must be met for an action to display in the menu by clicking + Add New next to Conditions.

Update the position of the action icon relative to the label.
Enable menu items to reflect status level notifications like Error, Success, and Warning.
Add conditions that must be met for the element to display.
Style your menu element using the Style panel.
Beginning Summer '22, use your mouse and keyboard to open or close the menu and move through the menu items.

Whatâ€™s next: Preview your FlexCard. See Preview a FlexCard.
title: Adding Menus to FlexCards
